definition: plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: The few enormously rich battened on the poor.
sentences.chinese: 为数不多的富豪盘剥穷人，养肥自己。

sentences.english: Slinky is like a child, and you don't exploit your child.
sentences.chinese: 斯林克就像一个孩子，你不会盘剥你的孩子。

sentences.english: This will inevitably suck resources from elsewhere in the health service.
sentences.chinese: 这种作法无疑将会盘剥公共医疗部门中其他的资源。

definition: to tax by force and extort levies (idiom); to screw taxes out of the people by force
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
to press (fruit)/variant of 敲詐|敲诈[qiao1 zha4]
to press/to squeeze/to extract juice, oil etc by squeezing
taxation/in former times, esp. land tax
